intro: Lippia salsa, commonly known as Mexican mint or wild mint, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its leaves are fragrant when crushed, and it is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Lippia salsa is also a popular ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of cultivation.
